answers.answer: Being induced usually causes longer labor and people say it is more painful . I'm due today and not thinned or dialated my doctor said its soft but that's it , and if I'm still pregnant in a week I'll be induced .

I say some ppl want to and some go Over their due date and no sign of labor. Or to complications. I'm 26 weeks 2days and I just takes to me doctor today about being induced I was induced with my first and kinda wanna be induce with this one too he said a week bfor my due date I can unless he comes before that

My doc says if I go a week over my due date he'll induce me, something about the placenta getting too old after a week over due. I wouldn't choose to be induced though and I hope I don't have to. It seems like everyone I know gets induced though.
Wen i went into labor on my own sucked i liked noing wen it was going to happend it was faster for me and didn't hurt as much with my frist and honestly every women and child is different

My doctor was trynna induce me almost a week before my due date because that was her day at the hospital I got her to postpone for a week:/ I'm scared of being induce for the same reasons. I want my baby to come on her own

I'm getting induced because my husbands boss is a jerk & wont let him even take the day I give birth off unless he schedules it 3 weeks ahead of time. I went into natural labor with my first 2 & was induced with my 3rd I thought natural labor went a lot slower but was less painful
I was induced with my first and labor went just fine. I didn't think it was excruciating or anything. Plan on getting induced with this one also so my boyfriend can be there when his son is born.

I think I will also be induced ill be 40 weeks on Sunday and no dilation or anything. But my doctor said he dont like for women to go past 41 weeks so does that mean he will induce at 40 weeks? I'm confused. I just hope she comes on her own!!!!

I fully agree that babies should come when they're ready; some doctors will schedule inductions for a time that is convenient to them. Some mothers will do the same thing. However, for some of us, it's a matter of being induced or risking our child's life. With my first I had an aging placenta; I live at high altitude and the lack of oxygen can become a problem. I went 9 days past my due date that time. This pregnancy I am having problems with my blood pressure and it is quickly becoming preeclampsia. So I am getting induced tomorrow morning. I really wanted to go into labor naturally but I don't want to risk my baby. I trust my doctor so I agreed to the induction, though it is killing me (figuratively).Induction rates are very high, but sometimes it is the right choice. Infant mortality rates might be higher (they would for me) if doctors never induced.
I agree. I waited til 42 weeks and my doctor wouldn't let me go any further. My induction turned into an emergency c section cause her heart rate dropped to 66. Cord was wrapped around her neck twice
They could never get my contractions regular either. And the closest they got to regular was 25 seconds apart

I'm worried for the same reasons, everyone I know that's been induced has ended up with a c section because they weren't progressing after the induction started. Fortunately my doc won't induce until 42 weeks unless I ask her to, but she also won't induce before 40 weeks unless medically necessary. I know there are ladies out there that have had great delivery stories with induction but I'm a ftm and it scares the poo outta me!

question: Why is everyone getting induced?  Im getting scared that I might end up getting induced as well. I seriously think that babys should be born when they are ready. Not when the drs want to or think its time. How is it done?  Those it hurt the same way it hurts to give birth on our own?
title: induced
